format: This data frame contains the following columns:

parameters.mtr: Marginal tax rate facing the wife.
parameters.kids5: Number of children 5 years old or younger.
parameters.unem: Unemployment rate in county of residence, in percentage points.
parameters.fatheduc: Wife's father's educational attainment, in years.
parameters.kids618: Number of children 6 to 18 years old.
parameters.wifecoll: Dummy variable for wife's college attendance.
parameters.exper: Actual years of wife's previous labor market experience.
parameters.city: Dummy variable = 1 if live in large city, else 0.
parameters.huscoll: Dummy variable for husband's college attendance.
parameters.wage: Wife's average hourly earnings, in 1975 dollars.
parameters.repwage: Wife's wage reported at the time of the 1976 interview.
parameters.motheduc: Wife's mother's educational attainment, in years.

reference:
Mroz, T. A. (1987)
The sensitivity of an empirical model of married women's hours of work to
economic and statistical assumptions.
Econometrica 55, 765–799.
description:
Description
The Mroz87 data frame contains data about 753 married women.
These data are collected within the "Panel Study of Income Dynamics" (PSID).
Of the 753 observations, the first 428 are for women with positive hours
worked in 1975, while the remaining 325 observations are for women who
did not work for pay in 1975.  A more complete discussion of the data is
found in Mroz (1987), Appendix 1.
title: U.S. Women's Labor Force Participation
